On Mon, 12 Mar 2018 at 03:42, Gunhan Gulsoy ***@***.***> wrote: As indicated just one comment above, this is a decision after we discussed with NVIDIA. The answer to why is driver issues in the ones required by 9.1, not many new features we need in cuda 9.1, and a few more minor issues. 1.7 is also building right now with CUDA 9.0 — You are receiving this because you commented. On Mon, 12 Mar 2018 at 03:42, Gunhan Gulsoy ***@***.***> wrote:
 As indicated just one comment above, this is a decision after we discussed
 with NVIDIA.
 The answer to why is driver issues in the ones required by 9.1, not many
 new features we need in cuda 9.1, and a few more minor issues. 1.7 is also
 building right now with CUDA 9.0

body:
Ok thanks for replying.

On Mon, 12 Mar 2018 at 03:42, Gunhan Gulsoy <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> with NVIDIA.
> The answer to why is driver issues in the ones required by 9.1, not many
> new features we need in cuda 9.1, and a few more minor issues. 1.7 is also
> building right now with CUDA 9.0
